title: please feedback on my new website!!!!!!
content:
Hi guys,  
thanks for reading this. I am a London based designer and want to start my own website and blog. And really, Im just looking for feedback really. The site is at...

[http://www.freddesign.co.uk/](http://web.archive.org/web/20080924161850/http:/www.freddesign.co.uk/ "http://www.freddesign.co.uk/")

and my first article at...  
 [http://www.freddesign.co.uk/2008/04/archive/the-new-look-bbc-website/](http://web.archive.org/web/20080924161850/http:/www.freddesign.co.uk/2008/04/archive/the-new-look-bbc-website/ "http://www.freddesign.co.uk/2008/04/archive/the-new-look-bbc-website/")

so I would love to know what I can do to make any of it better!  
thanks so much!  
Rog

 [‹ Arthur Mackmurdo (Arts & Crafts designer)](http://web.archive.org/web/20080924161850/http:/typophile.com/node/45189 "Go to previous forum topic") [Organic/Humanist typeface recommendations? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080924161850/http:/typophile.com/node/45149 "Go to next forum topic")
author: chasteauneuf

comments.content:
The colors and general look are solid, maybe a bit trendy but I use the magenta often as well. A grey for the black might soften it a bit and separate it from the ’80s—but you know what you are going for and how you want it to look.

You have a repeat image in the HP print piece.

I get a kind of Sex Pistols punk feel from it.

The cut-off “f”s (esp. the biggest one) bother me as they become “t”s, which is confusing. My eye wants to read the white text as “trend”
Wordpress? You need to do a bit more work on the template. Comment on the homepage, and other non blog pages, should go.

Thanks for the comments guys. I think the grey could be a great option. Know what you mean about the f’s now you say it. I guess my thought was that I just wanted to design it unrestrained and not be held back by anything. I thought that as its a website, nothing else, not a company I didnt have to brand the name at all, and legibility was not that important in terms of logos or anything. I was quite influenced by RayGun music magazine. The whole form over function thingy. But I think I definetely need to work on the large F a bit.

Wordpress indeed. Im knid of new to blogging actually, as you may have guessed :-)  
am just figuring it out by reading forums. Will work on the comments.  
thanks so much for the comments again.

I actually like your WORK in the portfolio better than the website. Don’t really know what it is. Maybe your logo. Not to keen on that now that I see in your portfolio what you can do, but its a straight up nice and easy website. Easy to figure out so I don’t waste time on finding my way around - which is very cool.  
One more thing. The big fat outline you have on the images in your portfolio kind really irritates my eye - without them - your portfolio would look nice, light and simply and easy to digest.  
Looking forward to you blog though...

I read tred instead of fred.

Also why bold italic?

This site is very functional and sharp looking.

The only thing, I would suggest is that you put a contact button all over the place. Also I put my phone number on each page. I get people all the time that pick up the phone and contact me right away. After all, you really just want them to contact you.

Mark Lewkowicz - Graphic Designer  
 [http://www.theaddesignguys.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20080924161850/http:/www.theaddesignguys.com/ "http://www.theaddesignguys.com")
